name: Bibimbap
short_description: Originating from Korea, this vibrant dish features fluffy rice topped with tender beef, colorful namul, and a kick of gochujang. Each bite bursts with savory flavors and a satisfying mix of textures.

name: Bulgogi
short_description: Savory marinated beef, tender pork, and a medley of tofu, shrimp, and squid sizzle over high heat in this beloved Korean barbecue classic. Each bite bursts with umami and a hint of sweetness, perfectly complemented by vibrant side dishes.

name: Banchan
short_description: Delights with an array of colorful, bite-sized dishes that accompany every Korean meal. Bursting with flavors from fermented vegetables to savory pancakes, each small plate showcases the art of balance and harmony in traditional cuisine.

name: Samgyeopsal
short_description: Sizzling strips of premium pork belly are grilled at the table, creating a smoky aroma that fills the air. Paired with fresh lettuce, garlic, and savory sauces, it’s a beloved staple in South Korean dining culture.

name: Gimbap
short_description: Korean cuisine shines with gimbap, a delightful roll of seasoned rice and colorful fillings like tender beef, fresh seafood, and vibrant carrots, all wrapped in savory seaweed. Perfect for a picnic or quick snack, each bite bursts with flavor and tradition.

name: Tteokbokki
short_description: Spicy and sweet, these chewy rice cakes simmer in a vibrant gochujang sauce, often accompanied by fish cakes. A beloved street food in South Korea, Tteokbokki offers a fiery kick that delights the senses.

name: Tteok
short_description: Traditional Korean rice cakes, Tteok, showcase the art of glutinous rice preparation. With a delightful chewiness, they balance sweet and savory flavors, making them a versatile treat enjoyed during celebrations.

name: Jeon
short_description: Korean pancakes burst with vibrant flavors from tender chicken, fresh seafood, and colorful vegetables, all perfectly bound in a light batter. Often enjoyed as appetizers or snacks, jeon showcases the heart of Korean communal dining.

name: Galbi
short_description: Grilled to perfection, these tender beef short ribs from South Korea are marinated in a rich blend of soy sauce, sugar, and rice wine, delivering a sweet and savory flavor that captivates the palate.

name: Japchae
short_description: Originating from Korea, this vibrant stir-fry features chewy cellophane noodles, tender beef, and colorful veggies like carrots and bell peppers. Enhanced with a sweet soy sauce glaze, it's a delightful balance of flavors.

name: Ansim
short_description: Savor the melt-in-your-mouth delight of South Korea's beef tenderloin, known for its exceptional tenderness and rich flavor. Often grilled to perfection, it's a luxurious experience that celebrates Korean culinary artistry.

name: Korean fried chicken (Chikin)
short_description: Battered and double-fried for extra crunch, Korean fried chicken bursts with flavor from ginger and rice wine. A beloved staple since its American introduction, it's irresistibly crispy and savory.

name: Namul
short_description: Korean cuisine celebrates Namul, a vibrant medley of seasoned vegetables often sautéed or blanched. Each bite bursts with umami, showcasing the freshness and harmony of traditional flavors.

name: Mandu
short_description: Korean mandu bursts with flavor, featuring savory fillings of meat, tofu, or shrimp wrapped in delicate dough. Often steamed or pan-fried, these dumplings offer a crispy exterior and a comforting bite. Enjoy them during festive celebrations or as a beloved street food snack.

name: Sundubu jjigae
short_description: A comforting staple of Korean cuisine, sundubu jjigae features silky uncurdled tofu simmered with tender beef, fresh seafood, and vibrant vegetables. Its rich, spicy broth warms the soul and ignites the senses.

name: Kimchi jjigae
short_description: A staple of Korean comfort food, this spicy stew bursts with the tangy flavors of fermented kimchi, tender pork or seafood, and soft tofu, simmered to perfection with scallions and potatoes.

name: Ssam
short_description: Originating in Korea, Ssam transforms fresh ingredients into vibrant wraps using crisp lettuce or seaweed. Each bite bursts with flavors from marinated meats, savory sauces, and crunchy vegetables.

name: Ansim
short_description: Tender and succulent, this prime cut of beef from the loin melts in your mouth, showcasing a rich flavor profile. Celebrated in Korean cuisine, it's often grilled to perfection, enhancing its natural juiciness.

name: Rolled Omelet (Gyeran mari)
short_description: A delightful staple of Korean cuisine, this rolled omelet features fluffy eggs paired with vibrant scallions, carrots, peppers, and mushrooms. Each bite offers a savory blend of flavors, making it a perfect comfort food.

name: Jjapaguri
short_description: A savory blend of two instant noodles, Jjapaguri combines rich, beefy flavors with a hint of garlic and sesame oil. Popularized by the film Parasite, it’s a comforting taste of Korean ingenuity.

name: Ssamjang
short_description: A beloved staple of Korean barbecue, ssamjang combines spicy gochujang and savory doenjang with sesame oil, scallions, and garlic for a rich, umami-packed dip that elevates every bite.

name: Kimchi bokkeumbap
short_description: Fried rice meets tangy, fermented kimchi in this beloved South Korean comfort dish. Bursting with umami and spice, it transforms leftovers into a satisfying meal, often topped with a fried egg.

name: Korean Corndog
short_description: A beloved street food from South Korea, this indulgent treat features a juicy sausage encased in a crunchy corn dog batter, rolled in crispy French fries, and deep-fried to golden perfection. Enjoy it on a stick for a savory, satisfying bite!

name: Injeolmi
short_description: Steamed and pounded to perfection, these traditional South Korean rice cakes boast a chewy texture and are generously dusted with nutty roasted soybean powder, celebrating flavors of heritage and comfort.
